docs.lead_paragraph: "Brother Officers," a new comedy in four acts by Leo C. Trevor, was presented for the first time in this city at the Empire Theatre last night, and cordially welcomed. The play is of a pleasing quality, if not exactly brilliant, and it contains some exceedingly refreshing and effective scenes. The hero, John Hinds, is a "ranker," an army officer who has risen by promotion from the ranks.

headline.main: DRAMATIC AND MUSICAL; A New English Comedy at the Empire Theatre. HENRY K. HADLEY'S CONCERT "Brother Officers" Will Run Well -- Yesterday's Music -- Gossip of the Stage.

docs.abstract: Hadley, Henry K.; Works, "The Four Seasons" and "Youth and Life," Performed at the Waldorf-Astoria
